description: Triangle of coefficients in expansion of (1+8x)^n.
comments: T(n,k) equals the number of n-length words on {0,1,...,8} having n-k zeros. - _Milan Janjic_, Jul 24 2015
formula: G.f.: 1 / [1 - x(1+8y)].T(n,k) = 8^k*C(n,k) = Sum_{i=n-k..n} C(i,n-k)*C(n,i)*7^(n-i). Row sums are 9^n = A001019. - _Mircea Merca_, Apr 28 2012
maple: T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, k), k=0..n))((1+8*x)^n):seq(T(n), n=0..10);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Jul 25 2015
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
